mods.note: A V FILE J S (S 10260/1102/91) rr y ^7 P0H3IGT OFFICE, tg.- A . _j ' — ,0 1 i H— 3rd September, H4<f. ^ 5179 «• f3?s: t I enclose a copy of a letter received from the Persian Gulf Residency and should be grateful for your assistance in connexion with the supply of copies of the report by Von Krafft and Oldham. G.J. Parr Esq. , Commonwealth Relations Office■■■■ * ' d) PERSIAN GULF RESIDENCY, BAHRAIN, 13th August, 1949. (322/8/49) ^ 11 • | ; Dear Department, The recent report of Sir Cyril Fox on the Geology and Mineral resources of Dhofar (E 7571/1103/91 of 21st June refers) mentions on pages 46-47 a previous report by A.L. Von Krafft and Cldham on the same subject. It is believed that this latter report forms a part of the proceedings of the Geological Survey of India* Vve have not been able to find a copy of the report of von Krafft and cldham locally, and we should be grateful if you could make enquiries from cue Commonwealth Relations Office with a view to their supplying a copy for this Residency and also a copy for the Agency at Muscat, who likewise do not possess one* Yours ever, Eastern Department, RESIDENCY. Foreign Office, London. ■ ■ / .. ••/

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Pol Ext 8303/49 'Geology and mineral resources of Dhofar: request for reports of A L von Krafft and R P Oldham 1900-01'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 56; these numbers are written in pencil and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file contains papers relating to the mineral resources and geological formations of Dhofar province in Oman. The file's contents revolve around the publication of a report compiled by Sir Cyril Sankey Fox in 1947 called 'The Geology and Mineral Resources of Dhufar Province, Muscat and Oman', which was published on behalf of the Sultan of Muscat and Oman. The contents of the report relied on a mineral audit compiled by the Geological Survey of India.
